pain_points: don't know which AI tools to use

problems_validated.problem: Massive skills gap in AI literacy among employees
problems_validated.market_gap: Most training doesn't cover AI skills specifically

problems_validated.problem: Business confusion about AI implementation and tool selection
problems_validated.severity: Causing companies to waste money on wrong AI investments
problems_validated.market_gap: Most businesses know absolutely nothing about AI

products_tools.name: Chat GPT

products_tools.name: Make
products_tools.metrics: IT workers hated trying to learn it

products_tools.name: N8N
products_tools.metrics: Everyone hated trying to learn it

products_tools.name: Rumora AI

business_strategies.strategy: AI workshops - 1-2 hour training sessions for company teams
business_strategies.implementation: Start with free workshops to local businesses to build confidence and testimonials
business_strategies.expected_results: Can sell for $10,000 as upsell within consulting offers
business_strategies.case_study: Job Sheila made €250,000 selling Chat GPT workshops to Dutch companies

business_strategies.strategy: Online AI courses for corporate training
business_strategies.implementation: Create simple practical training on topics like Chat GPT crash courses, AI for marketing teams, prompt engineering
business_strategies.expected_results: Charges between $1,500 to $2,800 per course plus monthly fees
business_strategies.case_study: Alex Northstar creates training programs and gets ongoing monthly support fees

business_strategies.strategy: AI tools consulting - act as AI doctor to diagnose and prescribe solutions
business_strategies.implementation: Learn top 50 AI tools in a week, understand business operations, recommend appropriate tools
business_strategies.expected_results: Part of $644 billion AI spending market
business_strategies.case_study: Morningside AI sells workshops as $10,000 upsells

problems_solutions.problem: Companies lack AI skills training for employees
problems_solutions.solution: Offer AI workshops and online courses
steps: Learn AI tools and concepts from free online resources
problems_solutions.time_estimate: Can learn basics in a week

problems_solutions.problem: Businesses confused about which AI tools to use
steps: Learn top 50 AI tools by watching YouTube videos
problems_solutions.time_estimate: Learn top 50 AI tools in a week

startup_ideas.target_market: Companies with employees needing AI skills

startup_ideas.investment_needed: Time to learn top AI tools

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Thinking you need to be an AI expert to start
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: You just need to know more than the businesses you're helping
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Most businesses know absolutely nothing about AI

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Believing you need coding skills to make money with AI
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Being stuck outside the AI field
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Creator made $7 million without coding skills

actionable_quotes.quote: You don't actually need to be some crazy AI expert. You just need to know more than they do, more than the businesses that you're going to help.
actionable_quotes.actionability: Start learning AI basics to help businesses rather than waiting to become an expert

actionable_quotes.quote: Why would I hire more people when your current team could do 40% more work?
actionable_quotes.context: Business owner perspective on AI productivity gains
actionable_quotes.actionability: Position AI training as productivity investment rather than cost

comment_insights.insight: Strong demand validation for AI business opportunities with users actively implementing strategies
comment_insights.evidence: Honestly, seeing how much demand there is for basic AI skills blew my mind
comment_insights.author: @@mrroni_00
comment_insights.relevance: Confirms market demand for basic AI skills training

comment_insights.insight: Technical founders struggle with marketing despite having technical skills
comment_insights.evidence: I am excellent in tech. But I suck at marketing. The stuff you say I can do easily, but I seriously suck at marketing.
comment_insights.author: @@andrejristic3958
comment_insights.relevance: Reveals common pain point of technical skill vs business skill gap

comment_insights.insight: Automation tools like Make and N8N have poor user experience
comment_insights.evidence: Everyone hated trying to learn both of those programs
comment_insights.author: @@colinbailey7161
comment_insights.relevance: Opportunity for better user-friendly automation solutions
